snippet: Some American officials and political analysts say the downfall of Syria’s leader could also undermine Iran as its economy reels under sanctions.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; the fall of Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad could further undermine Iran as its economy reels under economic sanctions imposed to get Tehran to suspend its nuclear program; Assad's departure could cut Iran's economic ties with Syria, and also prevent Iran from projecting military power in the Middle East; Tehran has long used Syria as a conduit for providing military, financial and logistical support to Hezbollah in Lebanon and Hamas in Gaza.

byline.contributor: Mark Landler and Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Some American officials and political analysts say the downfall of Syria’s leader could also undermine Iran as its economy reels under sanctions.

headline.seo: Syria and Iran Feel Pressure of Sanctions
headline.main: As Syria Wobbles Under Pressure, Iran Feels the Weight of an Alliance
headline.print_headline: As Syria Wobbles Under Pressure, Iran Feels the Weight of an Alliance
